Serialized Form

  • Package edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Bullet extends InGameObject implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • ammo

          int ammo
          This field represents the count or amount of ammo that the Bullet object has.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Character extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • positionRow

          int positionRow
          This field represents the row position in the grid for the Character.

        • positionColumn

          int positionColumn
          This field represents the column position in the grid for the Character.

        • alive

          boolean alive
          This field determines whether the Character is alive or not. True would make the Character alive, while false would mean they are not alive.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Enemy extends Character implements Serializable

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Goggle extends InGameObject implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • secondColumn

          int secondColumn
          This field represents the column of the second position the night vision goggles allows the player to look in.

        • secondRow

          int secondRow
          This field represents the row of the second position the night vision goggles allows the player to look in.

        • isOn

          boolean isOn
          This field represents whether or not the night vision goggles are turned on or off.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Grid extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • debugMode

          boolean debugMode
          This field represents whether or not the Debug Mode is turned on.

        • user

          Player user
          This field represents an instance of the Player class. In addition to this, the player's starting position is passed in as the argument.

        • specialRoom

          Room[] specialRoom
          This field represents an array of instances of the Room class. There are nine rooms in the 9x9 grid. The instances of the Room class are only initialized, but not assigned positions.

        • goggle

          Goggle goggle
          This field represents an instance of the Goggle class.

        • ninjas

          Enemy[] ninjas
          This field represents an array of the Enemy class. There are six enemies that are created to be used in the game. The instances of the Enemy class are only initialized, but not assigned positions.

        • rand

          java.util.Random rand
          This field represents an instance of the Random class. This will allow the Grid class to randomize the positions of objects' positions, such as the enemies, power-ups, and the briefcase location.

        • bullet

          Bullet bullet
          This field represents an instance of the Bullet class. This class is assigned a null value initially. Once the player steps on the Bullet power-up, the class will be initialized and created.

        • invinc

          Invincibility invinc
          This field represents an instance of the Invincibility class. This class is assigned a null value initially. Once the player steps on the Invincibility power-up, the class will be initialized and created.

        • radar

          Radar radar
          This field represents an instance of the Radar class. This class is assigned a null value initially. Once the player steps on the Radar power-up, the class will be initialized and created.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Gun extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • ammo

          int ammo
          This field represents the amount of ammo in the Player's gun.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.InGameObject extends java.lang.Object implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • positionRow

          int positionRow
          This field represents the row of the position the object is in.

        • positionColumn

          int positionColumn
          This field represents the column of the position the object is in.

        • onBoard

          boolean onBoard
          This field represents whether or not the object is still on the board or not. If true, then the item is still on the board. If false, then the item has been used or is off the board.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Invincibility extends InGameObject implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • count

          int count
          This field represents the count for the Invincibility object. It will initially be set to 0.

        • turnOnInvinc

          boolean turnOnInvinc
          This field represents the turning on of the invincibility. True will turn on the invincibility and false will turn it off.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Player extends Character implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • playerGun

          Gun playerGun
          This field represents the player's gun. The player's gun will initially have one bullet.

        • lives

          int lives
          This field represents the amount of lives the player has. Once the player's lives runs to zero, the game will be over.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Radar extends InGameObject implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • turnOnRadar

          boolean turnOnRadar
          This field represents the switch of radar powerup. It will be initially set to be false or turned off.

    • Class edu.cpp.cs.cs141.finalProject.Room extends InGameObject implements Serializable

      • Serialized Fields

        • hasBriefcase

          boolean hasBriefcase
          This field represents whether there is a briefcase in the room.
